meanings.definition: In a manner related to the movement of an organism or cell in response to a chemical stimulus.
meanings.sent1: The amoeba moved chemotactically towards the sugar in the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The white blood cells chemotactically followed the trail of bacteria to fight infection.
meanings.sent3: The curious bacteria chemotactically danced towards the enticing chemical.
meanings.sent4: Like a magnet, the chemical signal chemotactically pulled the cell in its direction.
meanings.sent5: The plant roots stretched chemotactically towards the nutrient-rich soil.

meanings.definition: In a way that involves the directed movement of an organism or cell towards or away from a chemical substance.
meanings.sent1: The fish swam chemotactically towards the scent of food in the water.
meanings.sent2: The cell moved chemotactically away from the toxic chemical to protect itself.
meanings.sent3: The ants followed the chemotactically laid pheromone trail to find food.
meanings.sent4: The moth fluttered chemotactically towards the alluring aroma of the flower.
meanings.sent5: The bacteria dispersed chemotactically in search of a more favorable environment.
